chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Francis Tuescher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs shall be collected by the Dept. of Correction as a condition of Extended Supervision and/or Probation.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.

Defendant Charles Francis Tuescher in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Charles Francis Tuescher.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Witt Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" - Both Counts .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Witt re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Defendant is advised of their voting rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Burdick joins in the motions.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld Probation for a Period of 3 Years
